definition: to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
sentences.chinese: 你們看見大衛城的破口很多，便聚積下池的水。

sentences.english: It is triggered when electrical charges build up in storm clouds.
sentences.chinese: 電荷在積雨雲中聚積起來就會觸發閃電。

sentences.english: In the environment, dioxins tend to accumulate in the food chain.
sentences.chinese: 在環境中，二噁英容易聚積在食物鏈中。

sentences.english: The models are meant to show, by analogy, how matter is built up.
sentences.chinese: 這些模型旨在用類比法顯示物質是如何聚積而成的。

sentences.english: An accumulation of data to be processed.
sentences.chinese: 要措置的數據的一種聚積。

sentences.english: Another thing that commonly triggers a man to orgasm is a build up of physical tension.
sentences.chinese: 另外很常見的觸發男人高潮的是身體上聚積的緊張。

sentences.english: The coal washability is controlled by coal accumulating area.
sentences.chinese: 煤的可選性受控於煤的聚積環境。

sentences.english: The rain collected in several depressions.
sentences.chinese: 雨水聚積在幾處窪地裏。

definition: choroid (vascular layer of the eyeball between the retina and the sclera)
to form a picture/to develop a photo/to visualize
